newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Bund set sights on 101.25 resistance.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Bund set sights on 101.25 resistance.

text.p: September Bund futures are aiming for the 101.25 level, although the early break of support at 101.00 may lead to a pullback, technical analysts said on Monday.

"The new contract will be stuck between the support and resistance, and it needs to break out before it can set up a major trend," said Nico Bakker, inter-market technical analyst at ABN-AMRO in Amsterdam.
The 101.25 level was a 38.2 percent retracement of the rally on the June contract from 99.05 in April to 102.59 in May.
September Bund futures were up 0.24 at 100.98 by 0700 GMT.
David Sneddon technical analyst at Credit Suisse in London said the break above 100.70/85 last week had been bullish for the contract.
"Now we're above there, it should rally further," he said. "We should see it heading for the resistance line at 101.40 from the February and May highs."
In February, the contract set a high of 101.99, and in May the high was 101.55.
"Once above the line it can challenge the May high," he said. He also cited slight resistance at 101.12/14 from price action. The contract stalled there in early trade on Monday.
On the downside, the 101.00 support has come under pressure, and there may be a pullback to price support around 100.85.
The accelerated uptrend means the market appears overextended in the short term, analysts said.
"Unless it breaks down through 100.50, not much damage will be done," said Sneddon.
At the short end September Euromarks were at 96.81, up two basis points from Friday's close.
